headline: It really depends on the team and the department you are going to work in.
pros: Prague department is in general quite decently skillful and you can meet outstanding engineers working there. Working conditions are just great: powerful laptops, huge curvy monitors, comfortable chairs.
cons: Absa is based in South Africa with the headquarter in Johannesburg. Everything that needs to be organized going to be a problem. If your colleagues are in Africa, then it is you who suffers from the remote communication. It is them who makes key decisions and your Prague department is basically to do what they say. Your voice can be heard but rarely taken into account.

headline: Great place to work, but not sure about long-term?
pros:
With its re-brand, Absa has become a truly pan-African brand with operations across the continent and perhaps even internal mobility opportunities in the future. 

It is a great place to learn while you work and there seems to be a commitment to widening your experience to a certain point.
cons:
The banking sector is under pressure to reduce costs and automate an become more digitally-led. Large scale banking operations like Absa and the other older South African banking behemoths are also less agile and therefore under more pressure from the smaller, newer startups. Ultimately cost pressures lead to continual cost-cutting and staff reorganisation measures which leads to job uncertainty.  
    
Absa as a bank for people and businesses carries a poor sentiment.  It rates low in customer service indexes in South Africa and struggles to shake the perception that it's an old lumbering institution resistant to change. 

The new brand delivered fresh energy to the workforce, but the Bank failed to capitalise on this fully. 

Career advancement is more lateral at mid-to-senior levels than upward growth.

headline: Resourcing Consultant

cons: Outdated systems, need more advanced systems.

headline: review
pros: Reasonable hours. Saturday hour are short.
cons: Highly demanding. Too much pressure. Low pay

headline: Support Analyst and Remote Support
pros: Is a nice company to work for, Benefits and people
cons: No growth , no development

headline: Good Company until.....
pros: Great to work for Absa, people are awesome, salaries are good.
cons: Barclays took over, culture changed totally. Became a UK company in terms of its culture.

headline: Financial PLanner
pros: no fixed working hours, you can print your documents for free, there are no real other pros
cons: management top heavy, they do not any value, high omission split and no support in return, on paper it looks great to work with a bank/branch client base but in reality you have to fend for yourself as there is a massive conflict of interest between the bankers and advisers.

headline: Portfolio Manager
pros: Large client base and because Absa is now part of Barclays, one can leverage of the global Barclays infrastructure and resources. Well known brands
cons: Too many untrained and inexperienced staff. Takes long to get things done. Constant change and staff turnover

headline: Financial Advisor
pros: The training program. The benefits are okay. medical and pension. great learning environment. potential for good commissions after two years
cons: Salary is low. Not enough branches for hired students. Hard work with no commission for two years. Clients don't trust financial advisers the bank so its difficult to get business

headline: Atm custodian at absa
pros: Excellent benefits to all staff
cons: Little growth for line staff

headline: Good and bad
pros: Good facilities, variety of people
cons: Underpaid, outdated IT systems, bad attitude in management

headline: Rough environment
pros: Opportunities within the Group to leverage
cons: Culture eroding the company and people

headline: Good company
pros: International exposure, on the way up again. Business units are starting to deliver again.
cons: Operating model but it is changing. To many bosses. Strategy not always clear. Catching up. Can be better at telling their story.

headline: Good company, bad management team
pros: Absa is a good company to work for but depending on who your management team is. For 11 years of my 13 year employment, I was extremely happy. During the last two years, I worked for a management team that was not qualified thereby limiting my abilities to perform. This resulted in my leaving the company.
cons: Unfortunately, due to the structure of the company, the management team can make or break your career. Should you start asking for assistance, you are seen as a problem that needs to be removed as quickly as possible with the least amount of hassle. But then, as previously mentioned, for the first eleven years, I was extremely happy.

headline: A bank that has lost its way
pros: Great people and deep digital knowledge. Incredibly welcoming and fantastic on boarding program.
cons: Unfortunately a combination of becoming Barclays Africa and trying to transform the face of their Digital environment created a chaos that I believe will take about 3 years to turn around.

headline: Great people and supportive leadership
pros: Great place to work for an innovative and enterprising mind.
cons: Frequent process and structural changes.

headline: From one of the best companies to work for to one of the worst. And this over a 5 year time frame. Such a shame.
pros: Depending on the department/management that you work for, it can be very rewarding. During the first few years at Absa, I received a lot of training and support from my management team. During the last few years, after a restructuring in the division, I reported to a management team that was not competent and this created a lot of problems, to the extent that I left Absa.
cons: There is a lot of opportunities in Absa but due to cost reductions, staff are overworked and stressed. Your work/live balance will reduce to the extent that you focus on nothing but work. This is very unhealthy. Currently, very few Absa staff is happy. When asked, most will tell you that they are in the market for a new job.

headline: its a good Company but the salaries could be better
pros: its a pleasant company to work for
cons: multitaking having ti di more work with less staff
